meanings.definition: To carry or drag something with difficulty or effort.
meanings.sent1: I had to shlepp my heavy suitcase up the stairs.
meanings.sent2: She shlepped the groceries from the store to her house.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tried to shlepp his giant teddy bear across the room.
meanings.sent4: The determined ant shlepped the food crumb back to its nest.
meanings.sent5: He shlepped the fallen tree branch out of the way with all his might.

meanings.definition: A tedious or difficult journey or task.
meanings.sent1: The hike up the mountain was a real shlepp for the group.
meanings.sent2: Cleaning out the garage turned into a long shlepp.
meanings.sent3: The endless paperwork was a real shlepp for the office workers.
meanings.sent4: The marathon was a mental shlepp for the runners.
meanings.sent5: The project felt like a never-ending shlepp to completion.

meanings.definition: A person who is lazy or slow-moving.
meanings.sent1: He's such a shlepp; he never helps with anything.
meanings.sent2: The old cat is a real shlepp, always lounging around.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy sloth is the ultimate shlepp of the animal kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The turtle is a lovable shlepp, taking its time wherever it goes.
meanings.sent5: The lazy student became known as the class shlepp.
